results.title: Reality bites
results.creator_credit: Jersey Films, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg and Ben Stiller
results.brief_description: Reality Bites is Ben Stiller’s directorial debut, and one of the more mainstream offerings in the array of films that emphasized the “Generation X” phenomenon. Lelaina is a recent college graduate out on her own and independent from her supportive, but out-of-touch parents, facing the realities of careers and relationships in the adult world. She can’t stand her internship under a local television personality, and is forced to choose between Michael, a well-intentioned music-video network executive, and Troy, a brooding, sensitive slacker. Meanwhile, she must also protect the artistic integrity of her video documentary that depicts the everyday lives of her friends and herself. Cast includes: Winona Ryder, Ethan Hawke, Ben Stiller, Janeane Garofalo and Steve Zahn.

results.title: Reach for the sky (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Daniel M. Angel and Lewis Gilbert
results.brief_description: The acclaimed film biography of British World War II hero, Douglas Bader, who after losing both legs in an aeroplane crash, overcame insurmountable odds to become one of the most decorated and remarkable fighter aces in history. The film is based on the best-selling biography, “Douglas Bader”, written by Paul Brickhill. The film stars Kenneth More.

results.title: Ratcatcher [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Pathe Pictures, BBC Film Unit, Gavin Emerson and Lynne Ramsay
results.brief_description: Set in Glasgow in the early seventies when the city was in the midst of a garbage strike, “Ratcatcher” is an evocative and powerful examination of working class life seen through the eyes of twelve year old James Gillespie (William Eadie). When the film begins James inadvertently finds himself the cause of a friend’s drowning. Living with this secret becomes increasingly difficult and he dreams of an escape from his life on a council housing estate, and an escape from the guilt he feels over his friend’s death. Realism is one of the strengths, historically, of British cinema and Ramsay’s film is both a taking off from the pioneer work of filmmakers such as Anderson, Loach and Leigh, as well as a poetic extension of this tradition. There is bleakness and sadness in “Ratcatcher”, but there are also moments of startling beauty and humanity. Ramsey is particularly good at suggesting the world as seen through a child’s eye, as well as detailing the clumsiness and awkward emotions of adolescent sexuality. With the most economic of means, Ramsay immediately immerses the audience in the textures and sounds of 1970s Glasgow. Most importantly, without didactism, without bombast, she eloquently gives voice to the immensity of suffering bought on by poverty; and moves us with a poignant testament to the dignity of human struggle. Cast also includes Tommy Flanagan and Mandy Matthews.

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Buzz Feitshans and George Pan Cosmatos
results.brief_description: Rambo is sent on a secret mission to help the U.S. Government find remaining Prisoners of War in Vietnam. However, although the mission is designed to fail, the bureaucrats did not take into account Rambo’s fierce determination, courage and skill to bring them back - alone if necessary. Rambo is launched into the jungle and the film explodes into one fireball action sequence after another.

results.title: Rambo III (Captioned)
results.brief_description: John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) finds himself caught in the war torn Middle East, after his longtime friend, Colonel Trautmen falls into Russian hands. The Soviets, equipped with state-of-the-art weapons, horrifying hi-tech helicopters, tanks and an army of highly trained men, are capable of annihilating any opposition they encounter. However, Rambo is no ordinary soldier, he’s a one-man army who will face the Russians head-on in the most awesome confrontation of his life.

results.title: Rambo III
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, Buzz Feitshans and Peter MacDonald
results.brief_description: Considered by many critics to be the best of the three films in the Rambo: ‘First Blood trilogy.’ The film’s plot takes on a righteous turn as the “universal soldier” Rambo seeks to liberate a group of Afghans from under the regime of a brutal Russian General. The action sequences in this film are both spectacular and terrifying, and the enigmatic, not altogether two dimensional character of Rambo rises above the conflagration with more style than in the previous films.

results.title: Rambling Rose
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, Renny Harlin and Martha Coolidge
results.brief_description: The traditional Southern values of the upstanding Hillyer family are about to be challenged. They’ve just hired a 19-year-old Rose (Laura Dern) as a housekeeper and nanny, unaware of the hilarious disruptions her arrival will cause. The very sweet and kind Rose has uncontrollable sexual impulses which cause her to ramble from man to man, bed to bed, leaving a trail of catastrophes in her wake.

results.title: Raising Victor Vargas
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal, Alain de la Mata, Peter Sollett, Robin O'hara and Scott Macaulay
results.brief_description: Victor (Victor Rasuk) a New York City teenager gets caught trying to sleep with ‘Fat Donna’ when his younger sister Vicki (Krystal Rodriguez) realises what he’s up to and spreads the word in the neighbourhood. Victor, thinking his reputation has suffered a blow, quells the summer heat with a visit to the local public pool with his best friend Harold. Here he meets ‘Juicy Judy’ (Judy Marte) and he decides to pursue her. Living in a small apartment with his strict Grandmother, sister and piano-playing younger brother Nino (Rasuk’s real-life brother Silvestre), Victor finds life as a teenager challenging when he gets the blame for having a bad influence on his siblings. Coming-of-age is tough (and sometimes comical) for Victor as he finds real love, gets a glimpse of what manhood is about and asserts his place within the family. Based on the short film “Five Feet High and Rising” by its writer/director Peter Sollett. Cast also includes Kevin Rivera, Altagracia Guzman, Melonie Diaz.

results.title: Raising Arizona
results.creator_credit: Circle Films, Ted Pedas, Jim Pedas, Ben Barenholtz, Ethan Coen and Joel Coen
results.brief_description: A pacy black comedy about a quirky couple who resort to kidnapping when nature fails to give them a baby. Hi (Nicholas Cage) and Edwina (Holly Hunter) decide to kidnap one of the famous Arizona quintuplets and in doing so trigger a wild chase across the country. Co-starring John Goodman and William Forsythe.
